query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: EAB Monitoring report
result.description: Outcomes from the EAB evaluation of how SEURO has met ethical legal and regulatory requirements across the project trial sites More specifically the deliverable will cover EC Ethics Summary Report findings and PostGrant Requirements GEN1 and GEN2 as outlined below1 Due to the severity of the ethics issues raised by the proposed research the Ethics Advisory Board must include independent expertise to monitor the ethics issues in this project and how they are handled This Board must be consulted in particular on the following points 1 how the consent strategy will be formed and revised taking into account the possibility that participants may lose their ability to sustain their consent and 2 how the ProACT system may impact clinical decisionmaking and the patientphysician relationship2 A report by the Ethics Advisory Board must be submitted as a deliverable after each reporting period

result.title: Seven national training courses
result.description: To disseminate the DRIVE 0 results and to create awareness about circular deep renovation, well-trained professionals are needed. Trainings will take place in two levels: National: The demonstration sites in WP 6 will offer realistic training cases. International: Two European training courses will be organized, e.g. in conjunction with ACE, HE, UIPI annual meetings and/or a session during an international conference.

category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Taxonomy of governance frameworks in Europe, learnings from the St-Vincent-de-Paul project and consolidated recommendations for the P2Green governance framework
result.description: The report will sum up the results about the benchmark of governance frameworks adopted in existing European projects related to circular N & P solutions, and a benchmark of a case study of decision-making on urine separation and collection in PARIS’ Saint-Vincent-de-Paul project. Based on this work, a taxonomy of governance models with recommendations will be developed and will then inform tasks 4.2 and 4.3. This report is linked to T4.1.

result.title: Report on results of actions for knowledge exchange and capacity building (4 focus groups) providing focus groups results
result.description: "Focus groups will be assembled in each follower region with the goal of supporting the development and adoption of P2GreeN's solutions in each region. These focus groups will emerge in the first year of the project, assist the feasibility study implementation in T5.2, and identify the pain points of applying the P2GreeN solutions. A series of workshops bringing together stakeholders identified in T5.1 will be held with the goal of increasing awareness and sharing knowledge of P2GreeN’s proposed solutions. Two physical workshops will be held in regular time intervals (M18, M36) in each follower region, where stakeholders of all kinds will be informed/trained on the specifications, advantages and disadvantages of P2GreeN’s proposed solutions with a continuous updating of the content moving from the first to the second workshop session. In addition, during the first workshop a twinning/mentoring process will be initiated, whereby stakeholders in follower regions will be ""twinned"" with relevant stakeholders in the pilot regions for the duration of the entire project with the aim of sharing knowledge, lessons learnt and best practice. The results of this workshop will be written down in this report (D5.5), which is related to T5.3."

result.title: ‘Scoping review’ describing the status of the legislative framework
result.description: The report of D3.5.1 will be a scoping review about the understanding of broader legal and regulatory frameworks that govern from fork to farm and fork again. These frameworks are not simply local or national, but exist on a multilevel basis; the international and EU rules in particular are essential to address. It is linked to T3.5. In T3.5, challenges and opportunities in these multilevel legal and regulatory frameworks will be identified, reviewed and evaluated.

result.title: Initial Plan for the dissemination ans exploitation including communication activities
result.description: Plan for communication, dissemination and exploitation: With the engagement of all partners, the first version of the D&E+C-Plan will be specified. It will include details of communication tools, dissemination approaches and channels of the partners at EU, national and regional level, and the overall strategy to ensure lasting impact. It will be yearly monitored, revised and updated (T6.2), and fine-tuned according to the results and the characterised needs of the partners, stakeholders and networks. The plan will be designed to maximise project visibility and disseminate results and outputs during and after the project’s lifetime. D6.1 and D6.2 are both related to T6.1.

result.title: Host P2GreeN international conferences
result.description: During the project, 2 conferences (D6.5, D6.6) with P2GreeN stakeholders will be organised in a key location to showcase the project outputs, and to provide a focused forum for discussion on the results of the policy recommendations and the continuation of the collaboration activities. This conference (D6.5) is primarily linked to T6.3, but also touches other Tasks like T1.1, T2.1, T3.5, T4.1, T4.2 and T5.1 as it will shows the results of this Tasks.

category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Culture, creativity and inclusive society

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Cultural Heritage

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: New ways of participatory management and sustainable financing of museums and other cultural institutions

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis
